bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, October 21st 1889

Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith,
To the Department of State

Consulate General of the United States
Monrovia, Liberia, October 21st 1889

Honorable William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.

I have the honor respectfully, in compliance with the instructions contained in your circular despatch dated August 16th 1889, to forward by this post to the Department, two copies of the National Anthem of Liberia. I could not possibly obtain a copy earlier than this date.

I have the honor to be,
sir, your obedient Serv't,
Ezekiel E. Smith.
U.S. Consul Gen'l.
